required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence and Mechanism of Exercise on Attention of Young People
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence and Mechanism of Exercise on Attention of Young People: A Prospective, Randomized, Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

brief_summary.textblock: RATIONALE: Exercise may improve the attention and mood in young people. PURPOSE: It has been confirmed that exercise benefits the health of humans. But whether moderate exercise can improve the attention and mood in young people still largely unknown. This randomized-controlled trial study aims to improve the attention and mood in young people through chronic aerobic exercise to see how well it works compared to sedentary controls.

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVES:
Primary
To determine whether exercise more than 30 minutes each time and 3 times weekly for 8 weeks (24 sessions) compared to sedentary life could make a significant improvement on attention according to the response times of the Schulte Test at week 8.
Secondary
To evaluate the changes from baseline to week 8 of the response times, correct rates, and omission rates of the Stroop Colour-Word Test.
To evaluate the changes from baseline to week 8 of the anxiety and depression by Self-rating anxiety scale (SAS) and Self-rating depression scale (SDS).
OUTLINE: This is a single-centered study. Participants are randomized into two interventional arms.
Arm I: Participants receive exercise intervention more than 30 minutes per week and 3 times weekly for 8 weeks. Arm II: Participants keep sedentary life without exercise.

study_design_info.masking_description: The outcome assessors and statisticians were blinded to group allocations.

primary_outcome.measure: the response times of Schulte Grid
primary_outcome.description: The Schulte Grid requires selecting numbers that are allocated randomly in a 6*6 grid orderly. The response times will be recorded to evaluate the level of attention and recognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: the response times of the Stroop Colour-Word Test
secondary_outcome.description: The Stroop Colour-Word Test requires naming the colour of words printed in conflicting ink colours while refraining from reading the words (e.g., the word 'green' printed in blue ink). It measures cognitive control and inhibition of concurrent automatic process of word reading, both of which relate to executive functions. It includes four conditions, each composed of 100 stimuli disposed in horizontal lines of 10 stimuli each, plus a practice line. Participants will be instructed to name the colour while refraining from reading the words. The response times will be recorded to evaluate the level of attention and recognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: the correct rates of the Stroop Colour-Word Test
secondary_outcome.description: The correct rates will be recorded to evaluate the level of attention and recognition.(correct%=number of correct responses/total number of responses)

secondary_outcome.measure: the omission rates of the Stroop Colour-Word Test
secondary_outcome.description: The omission rates will be recorded to evaluate the level of attention and recognition during the Stroop Colour-Word test. (omission%=number of omission responses/total number of responses)
The Self-rating anxiety scale includes 20 items and 4 points. It will report the anxious mood, physical symptoms, psychomotor behavior and psychological symptoms of participants.
The Self-rating anxiety scale includes 20 items and 4 points. It will report the depressive mood, physical symptoms, psychomotor behavior and psychological symptoms of participants.

arm_group.description: Participants receive exercise intervention 3 times weekly for 8 weeks.
Participants keep sedentary life without exercise for 8 weeks.

intervention.description: Participants in the experimental group will exercise more than 30 minutes each time and 3 times weekly for 8 weeks. The way to exercise is required for running. Participants must reach the speed when their heart rate is more than 60 percent of maximum heart rate.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Young participants aged 18 to 35 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Heart disease, hypertension, cardiovascular and respiratory system diseases such as asthma and are unable to tolerate the frequency and strength of exercise requirements.
- Any neurological or psychiatric disorders.
- Physical disabilities.
- Severe dysmenorrhea when they couldn't exercise more than 5 days before or after menstruation.
- Color blindness.

overall_official.affiliation: First Afflicated Hospital Xian Jiaotong University

facility.name: First Afflicated Hospital Xian Jiaotong University
